summary: The document is a confidential military record detailing an investigation by the 66th Military Intelligence Group into Henry S. Beer and his stepson, Joachim F. Beer (also known as Joachim F. Pehl). It covers their affiliations with the U.S. Army, Joachim's service, and his immigration to the U.S. Originally classified as CONFIDENTIAL, the document was later regraded to UNCLASSIFIED with certain deletions. The investigation revealed mostly non-derogatory information about Joachim, with the exception of a disturbing the peace incident in January 1974.
key_findings: The investigation was conducted by the 66th Military Intelligence Group focusing on Henry S. Beer and Joachim F. Beer/Pehl.
Joachim F. Beer had a background as a labor service employee before immigrating to the U.S. and serving in the U.S. Army.
Initially classified as CONFIDENTIAL, the document was later changed to UNCLASSIFIED with some information removed.
The investigation uncovered largely non-derogatory information about Joachim, aside from a single incident of disturbing the peace in January 1974.
